Kyle and Quags’ Mascot Pick-Em: Super Bowl Edition!

Picking football games based on reality is hard! But Kyle’s back and he’s here to break down the big game for you in the only way he knows how.

We’ve been away for a few weeks and I know that you missed me. Quags won’t be taking part in this final write-up, but I couldn’t let the people down. The Patriots (boring) and the Falcons will playing with everything on the line. Winners go to Disney, losers go… well they could probably go to Disney during the off-season as well. It is a magical place that can cure even the deepest of wounds.

Rather than pick the winner of this game using conventional methods, I’ll be breaking this match-up into three rounds:

1. Which Quarterback would throw the better bachelor party

2. Which Kicker would win in a dance-off

3. Mascot Tie Breaker (If necessary)

QB to throw best bachelor party: First off, I want to congratulate Quags on his recent engagement. Marriage is a big deal, but the bachelor party is an even BIGGER deal. I surveyed 5 males over the age of 25 and they ALL said having a good time at their bachelor party was more important than having fun at the wedding. Anyways, back to our regularly scheduled program.

Unless you live under a rock, you know the players. We have Matty Ice, a Philly boy (well, close enough) and TB12, a 6th round draft pick with 4 Super Bowl rings that married Gisele Bündchen. On the surface, this doesn’t seem like very much of a competition as we all know the lifestyle Brady is about, but I was able to dig up some Matt Ryan facts that may change your mind:

1. He is a HUGE fan of Popeye’s Chicken.

2. His favorite TV show is FOX’s “Fringe” (Has anyone watched this? Matt Ryan is so OBSCURE!)

3. I could only find two really interesting facts, but I’m sure there are more.

Well, alright… I think I’d rather spend my bachelor party with Brady, Edelman, and Gronk than eating Popeye’s Chicken and watching “Fringe” on the weekend. Brady takes this round.

(If someone can tell me what “Fringe” is, I’d greatly appreciate it.)

Kickers Dance-off: Totally understand if you’re unfamiliar with the contestants in this one, so here are pictures of Patriots kicker Stephen Gostkowski and Falcons kicker Matt Bryant:

Gostkowski eerily looks like Phil Dunphy from Modern Family. I couldn’t find any footage of Gostkowski dancing, but found some of Phil and it isn’t pretty:

I’m going to assume Gostkowski dances exactly like that and award this dance-off to Matt Bryant.

Mascots: We’re all tied up so let’s end this thing the way we started this series, with the mascots.

I want to pretend this last one is close, but it’s not. I’ve watched “The Patriot” over 20 times and one scene always sticks out in my mind:

I don’t care what you are, be it man or animal, but nothing has a shot against a man with a tomahawk. We’ve seen this movie before, Patriots take the final round and win the Super Bowl.

As always, thanks for reading. I consider myself an expert, so feel free to use this knowledge when placing your bets this weekend. If you win big, I’d really love a cut. If you lose big, I have a couch that you can sleep on while you try to get back on your feet.
